meanings.definition: Practice beyond the point of mastery.
meanings.sent1: She kept overlearning the dance routine until she could do it perfectly.
meanings.sent2: He overlearned the multiplication tables so well that he could recite them in his sleep.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overlearned where it hid its nuts, now it can't find them!
meanings.sent4: The student overlearned the material, making the exam seem like child's play.
meanings.sent5: By overlearning the song lyrics, she was able to sing them flawlessly at the concert.

meanings.definition: To learn something to the point of automaticity.
meanings.sent1: After overlearning the piano piece, she could play it without even looking at the sheet music.
meanings.sent2: He overlearned the driving route to work, so he could navigate it effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The robot overlearned its tasks and started doing them faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: The athlete overlearned his routine, moving with precision and grace.
meanings.sent5: Through overlearning the new language, she could speak fluently in no time.
